snippet.textDisplay: +grimdarkpixels Just that line made Sharla one of my favorite video game characters of all time. I don't get why so many people hate on her, she's a fantastic healer and Ether user, even more so than Riki and/or Melia.

snippet.textDisplay:
What an amazing song. So much emotion, and such a strong driving energy behind it. Where did ACE+ come up with this shit? I can't find any other songs like this... can anyone point me to some similar stuff? 

I'm no music expert, but the constantly rising chord progression during the chorus seems pretty...  unique, and incredibly powerful. I'm having a hard time finding any music that does anything similar.
snippet.textOriginal:
What an amazing song. So much emotion, and such a strong driving energy behind it. Where did ACE+ come up with this shit? I can't find any other songs like this... can anyone point me to some similar stuff? 

I'm no music expert, but the constantly rising chord progression during the chorus seems pretty...  unique, and incredibly powerful. I'm having a hard time finding any music that does anything similar.

snippet.textDisplay: +Kevin Stefan One reason is that you don't see electric guitars jamming with violins, another thing is the song keeps its intensity with all the strings piano ect
snippet.textOriginal: +Kevin Stefan One reason is that you don't see electric guitars jamming with violins, another thing is the song keeps its intensity with all the strings piano ect

snippet.textDisplay: +Kevin Stefan One reason is that you don't see electric guitars jamming with violins, another thing is the song keeps its intensity with all the strings piano ect
snippet.textOriginal: +Kevin Stefan One reason is that you don't see electric guitars jamming with violins, another thing is the song keeps its intensity with all the strings piano ect

snippet.textDisplay: +Kevin Stefan I think you might find some of that in a few Porcupine Tree songs (from the In Absentia or Deadwing albums), or The Mars Volta if you're okay with rougher atmospheres. But yeah, it's difficult to find a match.
snippet.textOriginal: +Kevin Stefan I think you might find some of that in a few Porcupine Tree songs (from the In Absentia or Deadwing albums), or The Mars Volta if you're okay with rougher atmospheres. But yeah, it's difficult to find a match.

snippet.textDisplay:
D:You fought beside me at Sword Valley!
- Why did you change sides?
- _Why the Mechon?_
M: You're as blind as you were then!
- I've wanted you dead for years!
[...] - I wanted to get the Monado so I could be the new hero!
D: Is that it!?
- That's the puerile reason you've killed all those innocent people?
- *Ravaged our home!*
M: I love this body. The power!
- Dunban, you'll never win!
- Get on your knees and _worship me!_
D: Never.
- I will strike you down and all that you have become, you wretched fool.
- The Monado will stop you.
- *And then you will know the shame of all that you've done, _traitor!_
M: Shut your mouth and _come on!_
snippet.textOriginal:
D:You fought beside me at Sword Valley!
- Why did you change sides?
- _Why the Mechon?_
M: You're as blind as you were then!
- I've wanted you dead for years!
[...] - I wanted to get the Monado so I could be the new hero!
D: Is that it!?
- That's the puerile reason you've killed all those innocent people?
- *Ravaged our home!*
M: I love this body. The power!
- Dunban, you'll never win!
- Get on your knees and _worship me!_
D: Never.
- I will strike you down and all that you have become, you wretched fool.
- The Monado will stop you.
- *And then you will know the shame of all that you've done, _traitor!_
M: Shut your mouth and _come on!_

snippet.textDisplay:
The release of the n3DS version better not devalue my Wii copy or I will be PISSED.

The only reason it became so expensive is because ninty underestimated the demand and printed too few for NA release. Oh sure, they wouldnt print more copies but they were perfectly fine rereleasing the game on an updated 3ds version which they also said they never had any plans of making? WELL FUCK YOU NINTENDO!

p.s. why the FUCK is kirby return to dreamland so expensive?
snippet.textOriginal:
The release of the n3DS version better not devalue my Wii copy or I will be PISSED.

The only reason it became so expensive is because ninty underestimated the demand and printed too few for NA release. Oh sure, they wouldnt print more copies but they were perfectly fine rereleasing the game on an updated 3ds version which they also said they never had any plans of making? WELL FUCK YOU NINTENDO!

p.s. why the FUCK is kirby return to dreamland so expensive?

snippet.textDisplay: Even now that the Wii version is out on WiiU from the eshop, discs and boxes for Xenoblade Wii are still aggressively sought after by collectors.
snippet.textOriginal: Even now that the Wii version is out on WiiU from the eshop, discs and boxes for Xenoblade Wii are still aggressively sought after by collectors.

snippet.textDisplay:
@bulbinking Huh. A mix of noble and dickish intentions.
Damn you, nuanced scalpers!
snippet.textOriginal:
@bulbinking Huh. A mix of noble and dickish intentions.
Damn you, nuanced scalpers!

snippet.textDisplay:
@Sazzandora11
The only reason I spent so much on the game instead of getting it through other means is because I wanted to support rainfall by showing nintendo people do spend money on "niche" games, and I knew it would retain its value for awhile.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Sazzandora11
The only reason I spent so much on the game instead of getting it through other means is because I wanted to support rainfall by showing nintendo people do spend money on "niche" games, and I knew it would retain its value for awhile.

snippet.textDisplay:
Why does it better if your game was devalued? Shouldn't the hope be that a good game should be spread to everyone who wants it, and therefore shouldn't be overly expensive?
That's the way I see it, at least.
snippet.textOriginal:
Why does it better if your game was devalued? Shouldn't the hope be that a good game should be spread to everyone who wants it, and therefore shouldn't be overly expensive?
That's the way I see it, at least.

snippet.textDisplay: I love this song and this game's soundtrack.  It is my second favorite soundtrack of all time and the variety of music in this game is a marvel to behold.  As for the game itself, i have played some of it, but not a whole lot.  I hope to get a good chunk of it played some time soon.  I honestly wish that i could play more RPGs, but i just can't section off time to play them for long periods of time.
snippet.textOriginal: I love this song and this game's soundtrack.  It is my second favorite soundtrack of all time and the variety of music in this game is a marvel to behold.  As for the game itself, i have played some of it, but not a whole lot.  I hope to get a good chunk of it played some time soon.  I honestly wish that i could play more RPGs, but i just can't section off time to play them for long periods of time.

snippet.textDisplay: @Bainbridge But it's called Engage the Enemy here in America too. Also, I was under the impression that the american release didn't receive any kind of localisations, as everything still has it's British spelling. Is there another localisation that uses English that I'm unaware of?
snippet.textOriginal: @Bainbridge But it's called Engage the Enemy here in America too. snippet.textDisplay: This is the year I finally play this game. I've decided this will be my big summer game once I return from vacation (I'll be away for a bit more than 2 weeks on april/may). With all the praise it gets, I'm very excited, especially with the sequel looking so good as well. Until then, I'll be playing through another game I've always wanted to play as a series fan: Deus Ex Human Revolution.

Until then, I'll be playing through another game I've always wanted to play as a series fan: Deus Ex Human Revolution.
